curam.util.connectors.mqseries
Class MQFieldMapper

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.connectors.mqseries.MQFieldMapper
Direct Known Subclasses:
MQFieldMapper.BlobMapper, MQFieldMapper.BooleanMapper, MQFieldMapper.ByteMapper, MQFieldMapper.CharMapper, MQFieldMapper.DateMapper, MQFieldMapper.DateTimeMapper, MQFieldMapper.DoubleMapper, MQFieldMapper.FloatMapper, MQFieldMapper.IntMapper, MQFieldMapper.LongMapper, MQFieldMapper.MoneyMapper, MQFieldMapper.ShortMapper, MQFieldMapper.StringMapper
public abstract class MQFieldMapper
extends java.lang.Object

Handles the mapping of one field within a class to/from an MQSeries string. The MQStructMapper class creates an instance of this class for each field in a struct and calls the encode and decode methods as necessary.

MQFieldMapper is abstract; each of the its subclasses deals with a different fundamental Curam data-type. Developers may also create their own subclasses of MQFieldMapper and associate them with individual struct fields to create their own custom messages.

This class is intended to be used by code produced by the Curam SDEJ generators but can also be used by handcrafted code.

Constructor Detail

MQFieldMapper

protected MQFieldMapper()
Default constructor for the field mapper. Note that this class should not be directly instantiated using 'new' but by using the 'newInstance' method.

Method Detail

newInstance

public static MQFieldMapper newInstance(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                        MQFieldMetadata metaData,
                                        java.lang.String fieldContext)
                                 throws AppRuntimeException
Creates new instances of MQFieldMapper classes and performs the necessary initializations. All instances of MQFieldMapper classes/subclasses should be created by this method only.

Parameters:
field - Specifies a field within a struct for which mapping should be performed to/from.
metaData - An MQFieldMetadata class containing information about how this struct should be mapped to/from an MQ message.
fieldContext - A string in the form "CLASS.OPERATION.PARAMETERNAME" representing the context that this field is being used within.
Returns:
An instance of a mapper for the field.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_NO_MAPPING_AVAILABLE_FOR_DATATYPE - if no mapping is available for the data-type of the field.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_CUSTOM_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS_NOT_FOUND - if the specified mapper class could not be found.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_CREATING_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS - if the specified mapper class could not be instantiated.

getEncodedFieldWidth

public int getEncodedFieldWidth()
Gets the width of the encoded version of the field being managed by this field mapper.

Returns:
An integer specifying the width of this field.

getMappedField

protected java.lang.reflect.Field getMappedField()
Returns the struct field mapped by this mapper.

Returns:
The field within the current struct which is mapped by this class.

encode

public abstract java.lang.String encode(java.lang.Object object)
                                 throws AppRuntimeException
Gets the encoded version of the mapped field within the given struct.

Parameters:
object - The struct class containing the mapped field.
Returns:
The field encoded as a String.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_ENCODING_FIELD - if the field could not be encoded.

decode

public abstract int decode(java.lang.Object object,
                           java.lang.String encodedString)
                    throws AppRuntimeException
Decodes some or all of the given string and assigns the resulting value to the mapped field in the struct. This method can consume a variable number of characters from the encoded string, to allow for variable-length encoded fields. The return value indicates to the caller how many characters were decoded, the caller is then responsible for using other mappers to decode the remaining data.

Parameters:
object - The struct class containing the field
encodedString - The encoded form of the data for this field AND subsequent fields.
Returns:
The number of characters consumed from the encoded string.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_DECODING_FIELD - if the target struct field could not be accessed.

handleEncodingException

protected void handleEncodingException(java.lang.Exception e,
                                       java.lang.Object object)
                                throws AppRuntimeException
Wraps an encoding exception into an AppException and throws the AppException.

Parameters:
e - any Exception that has been caught.
object - The object which was being encoded at the time.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_ENCODING_FIELD - always thrown by this method.

handleDecodingException

protected void handleDecodingException(java.lang.Exception e,
                                       java.lang.String encodedField)
                                throws AppRuntimeException
Wraps a decoding exception into an AppException and throws the AppException.

Parameters:
e - any Exception that has been caught.
encodedField - The String which was being decoded at the time
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_DECODING_FIELD - always thrown by this method.
